xwikidoc.title: Calendar Macro

contentDescription.name: contentDescription
contentDescription.prettyName: Content description (Not applicable for "No content" type)

property.description: Key for the Google Calendar API.
Google calendar IDs separated by commas.

URL to a page generating JSON. Example format:
[ { "id": 111, "title": "Event1", "start": "2012-06-10", "url": "http://yahoo.com/" }, { "id": 222, "title": "Event2", "start": "2012-06-20", "end": "2012-06-22", "url": "http://yahoo.com/" } ]
This is only needed if the JSON generated by the Calendar.JSONService does not fit your needs. The Calendar.JSONService can query events from any class with a date and a duration field (string)

URL page to update events when they are moved or resized in the Calendar. The following parameters are passed:
* classname: the classname holding the object (from the classname parameter of the macro) * startfield: the startdate field where the event start date is stored (from the startfield parameter of the macro) * durationfield: the duration field where the event duration is stored as a string (from the durationfield parameter of the macro) * isResize: if the event is resized, otherwise the event start date is moved * deltaDays: the delta in days of the move or resize * deltaMinutes: the delta in minutes of the move or resize * allDay: if the event is moved to be an allDay event
The default update service handles updating a document holding a specific classname with a start date and a duration field as specified in the macro parameters.
The editable parameter needs to be set to true for this field to be used.
Classname where the event objects are stored. The parameter is necessary unless a JSON service and and Update URL are provided
Field in the object where the start date of the events are stored. The field needs to be a date field. The parameter is necessary unless a JSON service and and Update URL are provided
Field in the object where the duration of the events are stored. The field needs to be a date field. The parameter is necessary unless a JSON service and and Update URL are provided

default agenda to show on load of the agenda. Possible values are:
month agendaWeek agendaDay basicWeek basicDay
Year of the date to show when loading the calendar. Leave empty for today
Month (from 0 to 11) of the date to show when loading the calendar. Leave empty for today
Day (from 1 to 31) of the date to show when loading the calendar. Leave empty for today
First day (from 0 being Sunday to 6 being Monday) of the week to show in the calendar. Leave empty for Monday
First hour to show in the calendar. Leave empty for default
First time to show in the calendar. Users won't see hours before this time. Leave empty for default (8.00)
Last time to show in the calendar. Users won't see hours after this time. Leave empty for default (23.00)
Field in the object where the end date of the events are stored. The field needs to be a date field. The parameter is necessary unless a JSON service and and Update URL are provided
The URL to access a calendar in iCal format (.ics file). If this parameter is used, the JSON one should be empty.
